sub_topic: Calculation of Carnot efficiency of a heat engine
message_1: A Carnot engine operates between a heat reservoir at 433 K and a sink at 273 K. If the engine receives 900 J of heat energy from the reservoir, what is the maximum amount of useful work that can be obtained from the engine? Calculate the Carnot efficiency of the engine as well.
message_2:
The efficiency of a Carnot engine is given by the formula:

Efficiency = 1 - (T_cold / T_hot)

where T_cold is the temperature of the cold reservoir (sink) and T_hot is the temperature of the hot reservoir. In this case, T_cold = 273 K and T_hot = 433 K.

Efficiency = 1 - (273 / 433)
Efficiency ≈ 0.369

The Carnot efficiency of the engine is approximately 36.9%.

Now, to find the maximum amount of useful work that can be obtained from the engine, we can use the formula:

Work = Efficiency × Heat_energy_received

Work = 0.369 × 900 J
Work ≈ 332.1 J

The maximum amount of useful work that can be obtained from the engine is approximately 332.1 Joules.
